headline.main: Bush's Exhortation at the U.N., and Firing Up the Hollywood Canteen
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: AN OVERVIEW: NOV. 10, 2001

lead_paragraph: George W. Bush, born-again nation builder and multilateralist, gave his first speech to the United Nations General Assembly, where he warned that all countries were potential targets of terrorism. So they would do themselves a favor, the president said, by standing side by side with the United States in this war. ACTION COUNTS -- The time had passed for tongue-clucking about America's Sept. 11 ordeal, Mr. Bush said. Action counts, he said, and that means other countries' sharing intelligence and cracking down on sources of terrorist money.
abstract: Overview of day's events in US war on terrorism (M)
